longInfo:
Passport required. 
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 180 days:
 - for nationals of Suriname; 
Minors:
- Passengers under 18 years of age, being nationals or legal
  residents of Colombia, can leave from Colombia if:
  
  
Additional Information:
- Nationals of Colombia holding dual nationality must
  
- Extension of stay possible for a total stay of 180 days per
  calendar year, for visitors who do not require a visa to
  enter Colombia. 
- Visitors traveling to San Andres Island,
   
- Visitors over 6 years of age traveling to San Andres (ADZ)
   
- Visitors over 6 years of age traveling to Leticia (LET)
   
- Visitors traveling as tourist are required to hold proof of
  sufficient funds to cover their stay and documents required
  for their next destination.
Warning:
- Visitors, traveling as tourist, not holding return/onward
  tickets could be refused entry
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Warning:
- Yellow fever vaccination is required for passengers
  traveling to Arauca (AUC). 
Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers of 9
  months of age and older travelling to the departments at
  altitudes below 2300m, except for those travelling to areas
  west of the Andes.
  Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk (high and low) in some
  municipalities. Recommended prevention in all risk areas: C.
